DataElement.preferredName: Person Current External Household Cigarette Hour Week Passive Smoke Exposure Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the current number of hours per week of exposure to cigarette, finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking, smoke by a person outside or external to a shared house or dwelling in a person who does not smoke.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Current External Household Cigarette Hour Week Passive Smoke Exposure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the current hours per week of exposure to cigarette, finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking, smoke by a person outside or external to a shared house or dwelling in a person who does not smoke.

Property.preferredName: Current External Household Cigarette Hour Week Passive Smoke Exposure
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.:A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes. Household is a common unit for classifying population data.:Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.(NCI):In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:Exposure to tobacco smoke products among individuals who do not smoke. This can result from sharing space with a smoker or from placental transfer from mother to fetus.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes.
Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
Exposure to tobacco smoke products among individuals who do not smoke. This can result from sharing space with a smoker or from placental transfer from mother to fetus.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
